frame.name: Personal_relationship
frame.definition: <def-root>The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal <fen>Relationship</fen>s they are or can be a part of. Some of the words denote people engaged in a particular kind of <fen>Relationship</fen>, others denote the <fen>Relationship</fen>, yet others the events bringing about or ending the <fen>Relationship</fen>s. Many of the words presuppose an understanding of states and events that must have occurred before another event takes place or before a person can be classified in a certain way.</def-root>

FE.name: Partner_1
FE.definition: <def-root>That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses. <ex><fex name="Partner_1">John</fex> is <t>married</t> <fex name="Partner_2">to Sue</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Partner_1">John</fex> is <fex name="Partner_2">Sue's</fex> <t>husband</t>.</ex> When the target word is a noun (e.g. mistress, lover, bachelor), that noun is annotated as <fen>Partner_1</fen> and, if there is one, the other member of the <fen>Relationship</fen> is <fen>Partner_2</fen>. <ex><fex name="Partner_1">George</fex> is a <t>bachelor</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Partner_2">George's</fex> <fex name="Partner_1"><t>mistress</t></fex> left the party.</ex> <ex><fex name="Partner_2">George</fex> has a <fex name="Partner_1"> <t>mistress</t></fex>.</ex> When there is a word other than the target that refers to <fen>Partner_1</fen>, that word is tagged rather than the target. <ex><fex name="Partner_1">George</fex> is <fex name="Partner_2">Laura's</fex> <t>lover</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Partner_2
FE.definition: <def-root>That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument. <ex><fex name="Partner_1">John</fex> is <fex name="Partner_2">Sue's</fex> <t>husband</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Partner_1">John</fex> is <t>engaged</t> <fex name="Partner_2">to Joan</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Partners
FE.definition: <def-root>The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>. <ex><fex name="Partners">John and Sue</fex> are <t>married</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Partners">They</fex> are <t>engaged</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act whereby a focal participant achieves an action indicated by the target. <ex>He <t>befriended</t> her <fex name="Means">by staying after to talk every day</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relationship
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Relationship</fen> between <fen>Partners</fen>. <ex>His wanderings caused the <t>break-up</t> <fex name="Relationship">of their marriage</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of the relationship. <ex>I'd like you to meet my <fex name="Duration">long-time</fex> <t>friend</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source_of_relationship
FE.definition: <def-root>The source of the relationship. <ex>Have you seen my old <fex name="Src">High School</fex> <t>buddy</t> Johnathan Rich lately?</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: husband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a married man considered in relation to his wife

lexUnit.name: wife.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a married woman considered in relation to her husband

lexUnit.name: widow.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman who has lost her husband by death and has not married again

lexUnit.name: widower.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man who has lost his wife by death and has not married again

lexUnit.name: widowed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having lost a spouse by death (without re-marrying)

lexUnit.name: spouse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a husband or wife

lexUnit.name: couple.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: two people who are married or otherwise closely associated romantically or sexually

lexUnit.name: companion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: Person with whom one spends time.

lexUnit.name: divorcee.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a divorced person

lexUnit.name: married.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the marital status of a husband or wife

lexUnit.name: betrothed.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the person to whom one is engaged.

lexUnit.name: bachelor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man who is not and has never been married

lexUnit.name: engaged.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having formally agreed to marry

lexUnit.name: engagement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal agreement to get married

lexUnit.name: marriage.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the formal union of a man and a woman, typically as recognized by law, by which they become husband a

lexUnit.name: boyfriend.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person's regular male companion in a romantic or sexual relationship

lexUnit.name: girlfriend.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person's regular female companion in a romantic or sexual relationship

lexUnit.name: single.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not involved in a stable romantic or sexual relationship

lexUnit.name: date.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go on a date with

lexUnit.name: break-up.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the ending of a personal relationship.

lexUnit.name: lover.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person having a sexual or romantic relationship with another

lexUnit.name: partner.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: either member of a married couple or of an established unmarried couple

lexUnit.name: mistress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman (other than a wife) having a sexual relationship with a married man

lexUnit.name: suitor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man who pursues a relationship with a woman with a view to marriage

lexUnit.name: court.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be involved with romantically, typically with the intention of marrying

lexUnit.name: spinster.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (chiefly derogatory) an unmarried woman, typically an older woman beyond the usual age for marriage.

lexUnit.name: estranged.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling indifference or hostility towards one's partner

lexUnit.name: friend.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically one exclusive of sexual or family relations

lexUnit.name: betrothed.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: formally engaged to be married

lexUnit.name: cohabit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: live together and have a sexual relationship without being married

lexUnit.name: cohabitation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or state of living together, generally with a sexual relationship

lexUnit.name: seeing.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: meet regularly as a boyfriend or girlfriend

lexUnit.name: widow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (passive only) to become a widow or widower

lexUnit.name: divorced.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having legally dissolved one's marriage

lexUnit.name: buddy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a close friend.

lexUnit.name: moll.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a gangster's female companion.

lexUnit.name: paramour.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a lover, especially the illicit partner of a married person.

lexUnit.name: inamorata.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a woman with whom one is in love

lexUnit.name: beau.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a boyfriend or male admirer

lexUnit.name: sugar_daddy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rich older man who lavishes gifts on a young woman in return for her company or sexual favours.

lexUnit.name: significant other.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person with whom someone has an established romantic or sexual relationship.

lexUnit.name: chum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a close friend.

lexUnit.name: pal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a friend.

lexUnit.name: cobber.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a companion or friend.

lexUnit.name: mate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a friend or companion.

lexUnit.name: crush.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an intense infatuation

lexUnit.name: affair.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a love affair

lexUnit.name: adultery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: voluntary sexual intercourse between a married person and a person who is not their spouse

lexUnit.name: amigo.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (especially in Spanish-speaking areas) a friend

lexUnit.name: sleep_(with).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have sexual intercourse or be involved in a sexual relationship

lexUnit.name: spousal.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: pertaining to one's spouse.

lexUnit.name: marital.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: pertaining to marriage

lexUnit.name: affianced.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: engaged to marry.

lexUnit.name: friendship.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the relationship between friends

lexUnit.name: romance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a love affair, especially a relatively brief and lighthearted one.

lexUnit.name: befriend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act as or become a friend to.

lexUnit.name: familiar.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in close friendship, usually intimate and personal
